H0.text: Hibernate in winter is what a bird builds a nest to do.

H1.text: Shelter its offspring is why a bird builds a nest.

H2.text: Produce more feathers is the purpose for which a bird builds a nest.

H3.text: Eliminate waste is the purpose for which a bird builds a nest.

A4.text: Birds that nest colonially may benefit from increased protection against predation.

A5.text: In constructing nests, birds act as ecosystem engineers by providing a sheltered microclimate, a hibernation site, and concentrated food sources for invertebrates.

A6.text: During nest construction, some species seek out plant matter from plants with parasite-reducing toxins to improve chick survival.

A7.text: Incubation, which regulates temperature for chick development, usually begins after the last egg has been laid.
